question: お風呂
sourceMnemonic: Let the <kanji>wind</kanji> in from the window above your <kanji>bath</kanji> so the water is cool enough for you to take a <vocabulary>bath</vocabulary>! If the water is too hot, you'll get all dizzy and that's dangerous!
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. This isn't the same on'yomi reading you learned for <ja>風</ja>, though. It's a little different: <ja>ふ</ja>. If you're taking a <kanji>bath</kanji> you'd be a <reading>foo</reading>l (<ja>ふ</ja>) to bring food in there. Drop the <ja>う</ja> or you'll end up as soup!
